page.title: 18THE VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: In the centre of the village stands a large, impressive red brick building. Built in 1780,it is a good example of a Georgian town house. Today, it is the hub of village life. Extensive alterations were made on the ground floor, a large lounge and bar were added and in 1973 it was open to the villagers to hire for private functions. In 1979 further improvements were added. Now,THE RED HOUSE,is a very busy place indeed.Bookings have to be made many months in advance as the halls are in great demand, providing a meeting place for all the local societies, a central venue for coffee mornings and pleasant surroundings for parties,wedding receptions,and dances. The Registrar holds weekly clinics here and the Parish Council, there monthly meetings.
